default: (a) a {@item shield|phb|shields} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item scale mail|phb} or (b) an {@item leather armor|phb}
(a) a {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (b) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}

fluff.name: Shaman
entries: Shaman are mortal mediators between the very elements themselves. Often spiritual guides of their communities, these powerful practitioners commune with the ancestors and seek to balance the raging elemental forces, and can call upon them in battle to scorch and blast their enemies, or to strengthen and heal their allies. Shaman can enhance their weapons with elemental effects, smite enemies with lightning strikes and bursts of lava, and summon powerful elementals to their aid. "Know this: a shaman must never demand power; to do so would arouse the anger of the elements, and a shaman without the elements' protection is nothing. Those that follow the path of the shaman must never forget this most vital tenet. However, a shaman that works in a respectful union with the elements wields a power rivaled by few." — Teo Hammerstorm

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a shaman quickly by following these suggestions. First, Wisdom should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the {@background outlander} background.

classFeature.name: Elemental Totems
entries: At 1st level, you gain the ability to craft totems and embue them with elemental energy. Chose one element -- Earth, Fire, Wind, Water, to be able to craft totems of that type. It takes 1 week to craft a new totem and embue it with power. Once per short rest, you may call on the power of your totems to summon one totem you have learned. You learn more elements and gain more uses as you gain levels. You learn a new element and gain one extra use per short rest at levels 6, 10, and 14.

classFeature.name: Elemental Magic
entries: The favor of the Elements has given you the ability to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting. {@filter Shaman spell list|spells|class=shaman}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the shaman spell list. You learn additional shaman cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the shaman table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Shaman table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter shaman spells|spells|class=shaman} of 1st through 5th level. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your shaman spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.
For example, when you are 5th level, you have two 3rd-level spell slots. To cast a 1st-level spell, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 3rd-level spell.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: At 1st level, you know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the shaman spell list.

The Spells Known column of the shaman table shows when you learn more shaman spells of your choice of 1st level and higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level. When you reach 6th level, for example, you learn a new shaman spell, which can be 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the shaman spells you know and replace it with another spell from the shaman spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your shaman spells, so you use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a shaman spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item elemental totem|patrick} as a spellcasting focus for your shaman spells.

classFeature.name: Primal Gifts
entries: In your meditations on the elements, you have been granted primal gifts, fragments of the Elemental Lords' power that imbue you with magical ability.

At 2nd level, you gain two primal gifts of your choice. Your gift options are detailed at the end of the class description. {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=PG} page. When you gain certain shaman levels, you gain additional gifts of your choice, as shown Gifts Known collumn of the shaman table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the gifts you know and replace it with another gift that you could learn at that level.
If a primal gift has prerequisites, you must meet them to learn it. You can learn the gift at the same time that you meet its prerequisites. A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class.

classFeature.name: Elemental Aspect
entries: At 3rd level, your attunement with the elements grants you greater power.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Elemental Totems
entries: At 6th level, you gain a new element and gain an additional use of Elemental Totems per short rest. (Earth: Stone Skin, Fire: Wrath, Wind: Grounding, Water: Elemental Resistance)

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Elemental Totems
entries: At 10th level, you gain a new element and gain an additional use of Elemental Totems per short rest. (Earth: Stone Bulwark, Fire: Fire Elemental, Wind: Stormlash, Water: Spirit Link)

classFeature.name: Elemental Focus (6th level)
entries: At 11th level, your connection to the elements deepens still. Choose one {@filter 6th-level spell from the shaman spell list|spells|level=6|class=Shaman}.
You may cast this spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

At higher levels, you gain more spells of your choice that can be cast in this way: one 7th-level spell at 13th level, one 8th-level spell at 15th level, and one 9th-level spell at 17th level. You regain all uses of these spells when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Elemental Focus (7th level)
entries: At 13th level, your connection to the elements deepens still. Choose one {@filter 7th-level spell from the shaman spell list|spells|level=7|class=Shaman}.
You can cast this spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

classFeature.name: Elemental Totems
entries: At 10th level, you gain a new element and gain an additional use of Elemental Totems per short rest. (Earth: Stone Bulwark, Fire: Fire Elemental, Wind: Stormlash, Water: Spirit Link)

classFeature.name: Elemental Focus (8th level)
entries: At 15th level, your connection to the elements deepens still. Choose one {@filter 8th-level spell from the shaman spell list|spells|level=8|class=Shaman}.
You can cast this spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Elemental Focus (9th level)
entries: At 17th level, your connection to the elements deepens still. Choose one {@filter 9th-level spell from the shaman spell list|spells|level=9|class=Shaman}.
You can cast this spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Elemental Mastery
entries: At 20th level, you can draw on your inner reserve of mystical power while entreating your patron to regain expended spell slots. You can spend 1 minute entreating your patron for aid to regain all your expended spell slots from your Pact Magic feature. Once you regain spell slots with this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Aspect of Enhancement
entries: You learn how to empower your weapons with elemental energy. You may empower any weapon you wish. You gain proficiency with it while you wield it and it counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. While empowered your weapon does extra fire damage equal to your wisdom modifier. It takes 1 hour to empower a new weapon and it remains empowered until you choose to break your bond with it or it gets destroyed.

subclassFeature.name: Aspect of Storms
entries: You learn the cantrip {@spell lightning jolt|Patrick}. Further when you cast lightning jolt and roll a 17+ on the attack you may cast lightning jolt again though one die step lower. I.e. d8 to d6, 2d8 to 1d8, etc.

subclassFeature.name: Aspect of Restoration
entries: You may cast Healing Surge twice per short rest without expending a spell slot. Additionally when you heal an ally they gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom Modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Primal Blast
entries: When you cast {@spell lightning jolt|Patrick}, add your Wisdom modifier to the damage it deals on a hit.

optionalfeature.name: Windfury
entries: You can attack with your elemental weapon twice, instead of once, whenever you take the attack action on your turn. Further you may use a bonus action to attack once with disadvantage and you may take a second reaction on your turn though only once per triggering event.

optionalfeature.name: Earth Shield
entries: You can cast {@spell Earth Shield|Patrick} at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Shield
entries: As an action you can surround yourself with crackeling lightning at will. The lightning shield lasts for 1 minute and deals {@damage 1d4} damage to an attacker whether they hit or miss.  This damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d4|1-9|1d4} for each spell slot level you have above 1st.

optionalfeature.name: Lava Lash
entries: When you attack with your empowered weapon and roll the maximum value for damage, you may roll damage again and add it to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Overload
entries: Your aspect of storms ability now also affects {@spell lava burst|Patrick}, {@spell ice fury|Patrick}, and {@spell chain lightning|Patrick}.

optionalfeature.name: Ice Fury
entries: You may cast {@spell ice fury|Patrick} once without using a spell slot. This ability recharges after a short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Master of the Elements
entries: When you cast a damaging spell, you may add your wisdom modifier to the damage it does once for every 2 damage dice (minimum once).

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Guardian
entries: When an attack reduces you below half health, you gain resistance to all damage until your next turn. This ability may be used once per short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Deluge
entries: Your healing abilities heal an additional amount equal to your proficiency bonus if your target is under the effects of {@spell riptide|Patrick}.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Lust
entries: Once per long rest as a bonus action you may infuse those around you with the limitless power of the elements. For 3 rounds allies within 30ft of you gain:
-You gain temporary hit points equal to half your maximum value. These hit points fade when the bloodlust ends.
-When you take an attack action you may make an additional attack.
-Spells at least 1 level below your highest level don't consume spell slots to cast

optionalfeature.name: Stormkeeper
entries: Once per long rest, you may cast {@spell lightning jolt|Patrick} 3 times as an action.  These lightning jolts may benefit from Aspect of Storms.

optionalfeature.name: Totem Keeper
entries: Increases the duration of all totems by 1 round and grants 1 additional usage of Elemental Totem per day.

optionalfeature.name: Reincarnation
entries: Once per month when you are killed you may instead return to life stable, but with 0 health and no spell slots.

optionalfeature.name: Ghost Wolf
entries: As a bonus action may transform into a spirit wolf. While in this form your base speed increases to 40 ft, you gain advantage on dexterity saving throws, you ignore natural difficult terrain, and you gain a bite attack that does {@damage 1d8} damage. You may not speak, or cast spells. If you fall unconcious in this form, you revert to normal.

optionalfeature.name: Traveling Storms
entries: You may cast {@spell thunderwave} once without expending a spell slot. You may cast Thunderwave with a range of 30ft.

optionalfeature.name: Cleansing Waters
entries: Your healing spells critically heal on a 19-20.

optionalfeature.name: Static Discharge
entries: As a reaction, you can have your {@optionalFeature lightning shield|Patrick} deal its damage to one target within 5ft of you.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Lord
entries: When you consume Marked by Flame the target takes damage as if they had been hit by your {@spell flame shock|Patrick}. Further if Marked by Flame ever expires without being consumed or you critically strike with Flame Shock, you may use your reaction to cast {@spell lava burst|Patrick} without expending a spell slot. Further, when you do fire, lightning, cold, or force damage to a marked target, you may consume the mark.

optionalfeature.name: Conflagration
entries: Once per round when a target is Marked by Flame each enemy within 15 feet must succeed a dexterity saving throw against your spell DC or also be Marked by Flame as their mark erupts in flame.

spell.name: Ancestral Sight
entries: Your ancestral spirits grant you sight beyond sight. Choose a point you can see, for the duration of the spell your perspective shifts as if you were standing in that spot. You see, hear, and smell anything you would if you were actually there. You may not move from that spot or interact with the world in any way. Line of sight for the purpose of casting this spell (and most other spells for that matter) is drawn from your character. I.e. you cannot use this spell to alter your line of sight for the purpose of casting other spells.

spell.name: Flame Shock
entries: You blast the target with a sudden gout of flames. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 Fire damage and is Marked by Flame for 2 rounds.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4}), 11th level ({@damage 3d4}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4}).

spell.name: Lightning Jolt
entries: You fire a bolt of lightning from your hand. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} lightning damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d10}), 11th level ({@damage 3d10}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}).

spell.name: Earth Shock
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to your wisdom modifer and one beneficial spell affecting the target of a lower level than the slot used to cast Earth Shock ends. Further if this damage would cause the target to make a concentration saving throw they automatically fail it. At Higher Levels.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the target takes additional force damage equal to your wisdom modifer per slot above 1st.

spell.name: Earth Shield
entries: You touch a willing creature and grant them an earthen shield until the spell ends. The target's AC increases by 1 up to a maxium of 20 and they reduce all damage taken by 1. Further when the target spends a hit die to heal, they may add the Shaman's Wisdom Modifier to the amount healed. Casting Earth Shield a second time ends the effect for the first target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the target reduces the damage they take 2 per slot above first.

spell.name: Lava Burst
entries: You hurl a sphere of primal magma. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d12} fire damage. If the target is Marked by Flame Lava burst deals double damage and the mark is consumed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d12|2-9|1d12} fire damage per slot above 2nd. Further if you use a 4th level slot or higher you have advantage against targets Marked by Flame.

spell.name: Chain Heal
entries: You conjure a wave of healing energy that bounces between multiple targets. Choose up to 3 targets within 30 feet of each other. The first heals 30 damage, the second heals {@dice 2d8} + your wisdom modifier, the third heals damage equal to your wisdom modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the first target heals 8 extra damage per slot above 3rd, the second target heals an extra {@scaledice 2d8|3,5,7,9|1d8} per 2 slots above 3rd, and the third target heals 2 extra damage per slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Crash Lightning
entries: You summon a massive bolt of lightning from the sky and leave the ground it strikes electified. A target you can see must make a dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 8d6} lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Further, a 20-foot-raidus circle of the ground, centered on the point of impact, becomes electrified. Any creature entering into or ending their turn in the area must make a dexteriry saving throw. They take {@damage 3d6} lightning damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d6|4-9|2d6} and the secondary damage by 1d6 per slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Riptide
entries: You conjure elemental water to sooth your allies hurts. A creature you touch heals damage equal to your Wisdom modifer and gains regeneration 4 for 3 rounds.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the target gains additional regeneration of 2 for every spell slot above 2nd level. If you use a slot higher than 3rd level Riptide gains a range of 30ft.

item.name: Totem Pouch
entries: A totem pouch is a small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all that is required for totems.

item.name: Elemental Totem
entries: An elemental totem. Totes awesome.
